If you consider yourself to be a gamer, then, Portal is must play. Extremely funny dialogue, great fluid gameplay, unique fresh game design, some of the latter puzzles will make you stop and actually use your brain to solve them... it's just amazing, truly amazing. The only complaint I ever had with, Portal, was it's fairly short, beatable in around 4-5 hours, but Portal 2 is much longer with extra mechanics to keep it fresh and addictive.

Of course, it's getting old now but it still holds up fantastically. Anyone worried about the graphics/textures being outdated and distracting, just downsample or use Nvidia DSR from 2160p and it looks fine, not Crysis 3 amazing, but not bad and doesn't distract you from the gameplay.

Portal is from back when, Valve made awesome, amazing, industry changing games. I played, Portal first back then and it blew my mind. Then 2 weeks ago I saw it in the summer sale and released I no longer owned it, as I gave my old Steam account to my nephew a few years ago when he first became a PC gamer so he had things to play. So I bought, Portal and Portal 2 for less than â‚¬2 for both... The best â‚¬2 I have ever spent!

Cannot speak more highly of this game and the sequel, which incredibly unlike most games/movies, the sequel is even better than the original.
10/10, would play again... and again.

For the longest time i've heard inside jokes about cakes and how amazing Glados is. People smiling and laughing about the greatness of Portal and other PC games while i stood outside of this party in the rain...standing on the tip of my toes just trying to get a peek into the widow without spoiling much for myself somehow in all these years since it came out. I finally got tired of missing out and decided recently to get me a computer and one of the first games i got was Portal (Thanks to my first steam sale experience, that was honestly overwelming...i dont know how you people deal with so much cheap games dangling infront of your face like that...umm eerrh anyway back to this review).

My God this game was great i always knew i would love it since well i love anygame that requries some critical thinking, Theres not much that havent been already said about this game in all these years but damn witnessing Glados at the end was a spectacle i'll never forget, and the end game credits, wow just wow did not even see that coming but man i love it. Man this game was so worth the long wait, im damn late to the party but damn it feels good...the cake really was a lie...

If you are still part of the group who never played portal and would like to give it a chance like i was, by all means please do yourself a favor and pick it up.

Next up on my list of games to get...Portal 2...i can't wait

Portal is an amazing physics-based first-person puzzle game with hilarious and dark humor.  GLADoS is a witty AI that loves scientific tests, and you're here to work with her.  Over the course of the game, you two will learn more about each other and yourselves.  The two of you will surely finish the game as best friends!  All 19 levels provide a unique style of humor and physics puzzles that builds upon itself.  It's a pretty short game (about 5 hours, depending on your skill level), but each moment is loads of fun with your friend GLADoS!

Portal is a game that the average gamer will surely enjoy. 
What I enjoyed the most was the vibe that this game gave off. Without being gory and violent, it managed to capture the sense of being trapped in a deadly labratory that you know nothing about. The small details of it, from the human handprints on the wall, to the writings on the walls made the game unique in its own way. It's cleverly made, so that the player will feel Chell's feelings and step inside her shoes, without replying on extreme violence and blood to convey the fear and distress that she experiences.
The puzzles are of medium difficulty, I'd say a 7/10 and they have more than just one way to be solved. The player is allowed to express their creativity and they aren't made to follow the same path as everyone else.

The only thing that I disliked about the game, where the first 10 or so, chapters. If you are used to playing puzzle games, all of them will seem really boring to. 

Other than that, this game is a 8/10 in my list!
